definitions: piece of land almost completely surrounded by water but connected to mainland
examples: Florida forms a large peninsula jutting into the ocean
The Italian peninsula extends far into the Mediterranean Sea

definitions: state of feeling or showing sorrow and regret for having done wrong
examples: His penitence for the mistake was evident in his apology
She expressed deep penitence for hurting her friend's feelings

definitions: person who repents their sins or wrongdoings and seeks forgiveness
examples: The penitent knelt before the priest in confession
Many penitents gathered at the monastery seeking spiritual guidance

definitions: federal or state prison for those convicted of serious crimes and serving long sentences
examples: He was sentenced to twenty years in the state penitentiary
The old penitentiary has been converted into a museum

definitions: person skilled in handwriting or one who writes professionally
examples: The penman crafted beautiful wedding invitations by hand
As a penman, he copied important documents before printing

definitions: art, skill, or manner of handwriting with pen or similar instrument
examples: Her excellent penmanship made her notes easy to read
Schools once dedicated hours to teaching proper penmanship

definitions: long triangular flag used for identification or signaling purposes
championship title or trophy in sports especially baseball
examples: The ship flew a red pennant from its mast
Colorful pennants decorated the stadium for the game
The team won the pennant after a dramatic season
They haven't captured a pennant in twenty years

definitions: short cylindrical pasta cut diagonally at both ends like a quill
examples: She ordered penne with marinara sauce for dinner
The penne holds sauce well in its hollow tubes

definitions: act or process of writing something down with a pen
act of confining animals in a pen or enclosure
examples: The penning of her memoir took nearly two years
He spent the morning penning letters to old friends
The penning of sheep happens before shearing season begins
Cattle penning requires skilled riders and well-trained horses

definitions: bronze coin worth one cent in various currencies especially US and UK
examples: She found a lucky penny on the sidewalk today
It costs ninety-nine cents plus one more penny

definitions: amount that can be bought for a penny or any small quantity
examples: He didn't contribute a pennyworth to the discussion
She bought a pennyworth of candy at the store

definitions: person who receives a regular payment after retirement from work or military service
examples: The pensioner collected her monthly check from the government
Many pensioners struggle to make ends meet on fixed incomes

definitions: plane figure with five straight sides and five angles
headquarters building of the United States Department of Defense
examples: The children learned to draw a perfect pentagon in geometry
A regular pentagon has all sides of equal length
Officials at the Pentagon announced new defense policies today
The Pentagon houses thousands of military and civilian employees

definitions: geometric figure formed by connecting five points to create a star shape
examples: She drew a pentagram on the paper with one stroke
The pentagram appears in many ancient symbols and religions

definitions: line of verse consisting of five metrical feet especially in classical poetry
examples: Shakespeare often wrote in iambic pentameter for his plays
The poem follows a strict pentameter rhythm throughout

definitions: athlete who competes in a pentathlon consisting of five different events
examples: The pentathlete trained in swimming, running, and three other sports
She became a pentathlete after excelling in multiple disciplines

definitions: athletic contest featuring five different events such as running swimming fencing shooting and riding
examples: The modern pentathlon tests diverse athletic skills in competitors
She won gold in the pentathlon at the Olympics

definitions: Christian religious movement emphasizing direct personal experience of God through baptism with the Holy Spirit
examples: Pentecostalism spread rapidly throughout Latin America last century
The church practices pentecostalism with speaking in tongues

definitions: apartment on the top floor of a building typically luxurious with special features
examples: The penthouse offers stunning views of the city skyline
They bought a penthouse with a private rooftop terrace

definitions: next to the last in a series or sequence of things
examples: We studied the penultimate chapter before the final exam
This is the penultimate stop before we reach home

definitions: partially shaded outer region of a shadow cast by an opaque object
examples: The moon entered Earth's penumbra during the eclipse
We could see the penumbra surrounding the sharp shadow

definitions: plant with large showy flowers in colors like pink red or white
examples: The peony blooms in her garden every late spring
She planted white peonies along the front walkway

definitions: quality of being lively energetic and full of vigor or spirit
examples: The coach gave a talk to put pep in the team
She always has plenty of pep in the morning

definitions: dried berry of the pepper plant used whole or ground as spice
examples: She ground fresh peppercorns over the salad for flavor
The recipe calls for six whole peppercorns in the marinade

definitions: aromatic plant with leaves used for flavoring and medicinal purposes
candy or confection flavored with oil from peppermint plant
examples: She grows peppermint in her herb garden for tea
The peppermint plant spreads quickly in moist soil
He offered her a peppermint after the meal
The peppermint candy helped soothe her upset stomach

definitions: compound consisting of two or more amino acids linked in a chain
examples: Scientists studied the peptide structure under the microscope
The peptide plays a crucial role in protein formation

definitions: value below which a given percentage of observations in a data set falls
examples: Her test score was in the ninetieth percentile nationally
The baby's weight falls in the fiftieth percentile range

definitions: branch or bar on which birds rest or roost
freshwater fish with spiny fins found in rivers and lakes
examples: The parrot sat on its perch in the cage
Birds use the fence as a perch between flights
He caught a large perch while fishing this morning
The perch is popular among freshwater fishing enthusiasts

definitions: process of liquid slowly passing through a filter or porous substance
examples: The percolation of coffee takes about five minutes to complete
Rainwater percolation through soil helps recharge underground aquifers

definitions: musical instruments played by striking beating or shaking like drums and cymbals
striking of one solid object against another especially in medical examination
examples: She plays percussion in the school marching band
The percussion section includes drums, timpani, and xylophone
The doctor used percussion to check his lung condition
Chest percussion helps diagnose respiratory problems

definitions: musician who plays percussion instruments such as drums cymbals or timpani
examples: The percussionist kept perfect time throughout the concert performance
She hired a percussionist for her jazz band

definitions: state of eternal punishment and damnation into which sinners pass after death
examples: The preacher warned of perdition for those who sinned
Medieval texts often depicted souls falling into perdition

definitions: fast-flying falcon with long pointed wings found on all continents
examples: The peregrine dove at incredible speed to catch prey
Peregrine falcons nest on tall cliff faces and buildings

definitions: plant that lives for more than two years blooming seasonally
something that is enduring recurring or appears repeatedly over time
examples: She planted perennials that bloom every spring without replanting
The garden features both annuals and hardy perennials
Budget concerns are a perennial issue at town meetings
The team faces their perennial rivals next week

definitions: state or quality of being perfect free from all flaws or defects
examples: She strives for perfection in everything she creates
The diamond was cut to absolute perfection

definitions: tendency to demand extremely high standards and be dissatisfied with anything less than perfect
examples: His perfectionism often prevents him from finishing projects on time
Perfectionism can lead to stress and anxiety in students

definitions: person who refuses to accept any standard short of perfection in themselves or others
examples: As a perfectionist, she revises her work countless times
The perfectionist chef insisted on precise measurements

definitions: grammatical aspect expressing action viewed as complete rather than ongoing in linguistics
examples: Russian uses the perfective aspect to indicate completed actions
The perfective form shows the action has been finished

definitions: hole or series of holes punched or drilled through something especially for separation
examples: The perforation in the paper makes it easy to tear
Stamp sheets have perforations between each individual stamp

definitions: act of presenting entertainment such as music dance or drama to an audience
examples: The performing arts center hosts concerts throughout the year
She has been performing on stage since childhood

definitions: fragrant liquid typically made from essential oils worn to give pleasant smell
examples: She dabbed perfume on her wrists before the party
The perfume has notes of jasmine and vanilla

definitions: person who makes or sells perfumes professionally often creating custom scent blends
examples: The perfumer spent years training in France
A skilled perfumer can identify hundreds of different scents

definitions: business of producing and selling perfumes or place where perfumes are made
examples: She studied perfumery in Paris for three years
The perfumery offers custom scent creation services

definitions: outdoor garden structure with vertical posts supporting crossbeams and open lattice
examples: Vines grew over the wooden pergola creating natural shade
They built a pergola to define the outdoor dining area

definitions: point in orbit of moon or satellite when it is nearest to Earth
examples: The moon appears larger when it reaches perigee each month
The satellite's perigee brings it within communication range

definitions: point in orbit of planet or comet when it is nearest to the sun
examples: Earth reaches perihelion in early January each year
Comets move fastest when approaching perihelion

definitions: serious and immediate danger putting someone or something at risk of harm
examples: The climbers faced great peril on the icy mountain
She ignored the peril and rescued the drowning child

definitions: continuous line forming the boundary of a closed geometric figure or area
examples: Guards patrol the perimeter of the military base nightly
Calculate the perimeter by adding all four sides together
